channel.title: 7. Numbers on WY Computer Science
channel.description: Recent content in 7. Numbers on WY Computer Science

item.title: Exercises 3
item.description: Write a function at-most-250 that takes in a number and puts out the same number, or 250 if the number is larger than 250. Write a function small-0 that takes in two numbers and gives out the distance to zero of the number that is closest to zero on the number line. It should work with negative numbers as well. Write a function stuck-50-150 that takes in a number x and gives out x.

item.title: Max and min slides
item.description: Maximum, Minimum, Random Make a Table Max = greatest. Min = least. Abs = absolute value. x (min x 10) (max x 10) (abs x) -15 -5 … Include x = 8, 13, 18 as well. Which keeps numbers small? x (min x 10) (max x 10) (abs x) -15 -15 10 15 -5 -5 10 5 8 8 10 8 13 10 13 13 18 10 18 18 Use Check-expect Always write check-expects when keeping numbers small or large.

item.title: Randomness
item.description: Random numbers: (random 3) gives a random number 0, 1, or 2. Notice that there are three possible answers, but they start counting at 0. Run the code below and you should get different answers each time. racket (random 10) (random 10) (random 10) Random ranges We use the phrase “from 10 to 200” or “between 10 and 200” to both mean all of the integers n so that 10<=n<=200.

item.title: Exercises 2
item.description: Exercises: hypotenuse: Given the lengths of two legs of a right triangle, return the length of the third side. slope: Given the x and y coordinates of two points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) - in that order - return the slope of the line between those points. (OK if it does not work for vertical lines.) distance: Given the x and y coordinates of two points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), find the distance between them.

item.title: Exercises 1
item.description: Practice the design process making each of these functions: Write a function that takes in the radius of a circle and outputs the circumference. Write a function to find the cost of a cart full of g pounds of grapefruit and b pounds of bananas. The grapefruit costs $1.49/lb and the bananas cost $0.59/lb.
